zone.line: But we yet stand
In a lone land
Like tombs to mark the memory
Of hopes & fears which fade & flee
Morn bleak
In the light of life's brief morning
Retribution from Moschus
Pan loved his neighbor Echo — but that child
Of Earth and Air, pined for the Satyr leaping
The Satyr loved with wasting madness madness wild
The bright Nymph Lyda — and so three went weeping
As Pan loved Echo, Echo loved the Satyr
The Satyr Lyda — and then so love consumed them
And thus to each — which was a woeful matter
To bear what they inflicted Justice doomed them
For in as much as each might hate the lover
Each loving, so was hated — Ye that love
not
Be warned — in thought turn this example over
That when ye love the like returned return ye prove
not
